entry.title: How did two broke journalists wind up with the famously unattainable bachelor billionaires?
entry.summary:
Author: tearsofjoyandsorrow

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,072Chapters: 7/18Kudos: 57

Summary: What if there were a universe where DC and Marvel were intermixed and we got to see the insane similarities of superbat and starker?In this universe, it just so happens that the Daily Bugle and the Daily Planet are sister companies working out of New York and Metropolis, respectively, and every once and a while, there are larger crossover events in which Peter Parker and Clark Kent interact. They aren't best friends by any means, but they get along quite well.Simultaneously, Bruce Wayne and Tony Stark are maintaining a strange frenemies dynamic. When the world looks like it's going to end, the two of them band together to resolve things, but outside of that, they frequently try to one-up each other with their tech, bank accounts and sexual conquests.I'm still not sure what I am doing, but someone said they would read this, so here I try!

entry.title: who's dating professor wayne?

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,714Chapters: 3/7Kudos: 148

Please refrain from discussing colleagues‚Äô private lives during work hours. Yes, this includes ‚Äúinnocent‚Äù speculation over coffee, Prof. Barry Allen. ‚Äî Office of the DeanClark Kent is taken. entry.title: Superman Cooks
entry.summary:
Author: DaniDany

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,051Chapters: 1/3Kudos: 16

Summary: Clark Kent, or as everyone knew him, Superman, the chef, was a dream come true. Attractive, flawless, and with a way of cooking that bordered on provocative, he made his followers watch more for him than for the food. Everyone, except Bruce Wayne. A thirty-eight-year-old man, single, a businessman, who replicated his recipes purely for his own pleasure and to care for his family. And yet, Bruce had also fallen into the trap of that man. Every gesture, every measured smile to the camera, ignited him in ways he didn‚Äôt know how to contain. But there was a line he wouldn‚Äôt allow himself to cross: meeting him in person. At least, not yet.

entry.title: Domestic Surveillance
entry.summary:
Author: brmqtr

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,243Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 65

Summary: When Alfred upgrades Wayne Manor‚Äôs security system, he doesn‚Äôt anticipate its most persistent intruder: Superman. Every time Clark lands unannounced, the alarms blare ‚Äî ‚ÄúIntruder alert: Kryptonian detected.‚Äù Bruce insists on keeping the system active ‚Äúon principle.‚Äù Clark, naturally, treats it like a doorbell. What follows is a domestic comedy of false alarms, jealous dogs, and quiet kisses between two men who save the world by day and irritate each other by night. But beneath the teasing, the noise, and the alerts that never quite stop, Bruce begins to realize the truth: he doesn‚Äôt want silence ‚Äî he wants Clark. Because sometimes love isn‚Äôt the absence of chaos. It‚Äôs learning to live with the alarm and calling it home.
